subject: Real Estate
subcategory: Famous Properties That Changed the World
title: The Globe Theatre: Shakespeare's Rental
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Globe Theatre: Shakespeare's Rental.

hook.text: Shakespeare's Globe Theatre was built in 1599 from stolen lumber after a lease dispute with the landlord.

buildup.text: The acting company dismantled their old theater at night and rebuilt it across the Thames.

discovery.text: The Globe held 3,000 spectators. Groundlings paid one penny to stand. Wealthier patrons sat in galleries.

twist.text: A cannon prop set the thatched roof on fire in 1613. The theater burned to the ground in two hours.

climax.text: A modern replica was built in 1997, just 230 meters from the original site, now worth millions.

punchline.text: The greatest theater in history was built from stolen wood.

quiz.question: Why was the Globe Theatre's original lumber 'stolen'?
options: The company couldn't afford new wood
A lease dispute forced them to dismantle their old theater
